name: The Starry Cafe
description:
A color combo of The Starry Night skein and the Cafe Terrace skein = The Starry Cafe.  ;-)

Color(s): black, gray, golden yellow, teal and purple (I use only professional grade acid dyes) 
Fiber(s): merino/bamboo/nylon 
Weight: fingering 
Length/yardage: 375+ yards, 3.5 oz/100grams 
Care instructions: hand wash, lay flat to dry

Why buy hand dyed yarn vs craft store yarn? 
-each dye batch makes unique one-of-a-kind skeins, nobody will have yarn like yours 
-it's made from animal and/or plant fibers, not acrylic aka fake 
-there will not be any knots or ties hiding in the middle of the skein 
-your purchase supports a small business and my small family! 
-made in America

name: Rocky Mountains
description:
These skeins are so smooth and soft, you'll want to snuggle with them all day! Stitch them into something that will be next to your skin - you'll love the feel of it! They were made in Italy and somehow every yarn I have worked with from Italy is amazing. There are only 5 skeins available, when they're sold I can't order more. 
Oh ya, I almost forgot - these are dyed to have gradual color change. Start with the darker end and it will change to tan and then the end will have a bit more teal again. Looks really neat when it's all stitched up.

Color(s): shades of teal, tan  (I use only professional grade acid dyes) 
Fiber(s): extra fine superwash merino 
Weight: DK
Length/yardage: 136 yards
Care instructions: machine washable, lay flat to dry

Why buy hand dyed yarn vs craft store yarn? 
-each dye batch makes unique one-of-a-kind skeins, nobody will have yarn like yours 
-it's made from animal and/or plant fibers, not acrylic aka fake 
-there will not be any knots or ties hiding in the middle of the skein 
-your purchase supports a small business and my small family! 
-made in America

(5 available)

name: Oh Christmas Green
description:
The texture of this skein is so fun! It's tweed and I dyed it with a gradual color change. I would suggest started with the green end and as you stitch it up the green will gradually become lighter and have more and more cream color. (There is also a red/pink skein similar to this)

Colors: cream and emerald green (I use only professional grade acid dyes) 
Yards: 122
Weight: textured worsted
Fiber: 80% wool, 20% nylon
Needle: #7 (4.5MM)
Hook: H-8 (5MM)
Care instructions: hand wash, lat flat to dry.

Why buy hand dyed yarn vs craft store yarn? 
-each dye batch makes unique one-of-a-kind skeins, nobody will have yarn like yours 
-it's made from animal and/or plant fibers, not acrylic aka fake 
-your purchase supports a small business and my small family! 
-made in America

name: Peppermint
description:
The texture of this skein is so fun! It's tweed and I dyed it with a gradual color change. I would suggest started with the red/pink end and as you stitch it up the red/pink will gradually become lighter and have more and more cream color. (There is also a green skein similar to this)

Colors: cream and red/pinkish (I use only professional grade acid dyes) 
Yards: 122
Weight: textured worsted
Fiber: 80% wool, 20% nylon
Needle: #7 (4.5MM)
Hook: H-8 (5MM)
Care instructions: hand wash, lat flat to dry.

Why buy hand dyed yarn vs craft store yarn? 
-each dye batch makes unique one-of-a-kind skeins, nobody will have yarn like yours 
-it's made from animal and/or plant fibers, not acrylic aka fake 
-your purchase supports a small business and my small family! 
-made in America

name: The Wedding Dress
description:
Second skein inspired by a costume in the new Hunger Games film, Catching Fire. This is Katniss' would-be wedding dress. I tried to capture the silver from her metal jewelry and the teal from her eyeshadow. This skein is 100% silk which leaves a shiny glow when dyed. :-) Please keep in mind that each skein is dyed individually and each one is slightly different from the skein in the photos. Even when I use same amount of dye and paint it the same way, each is still unique.

Colors: silvery gray, hint of teal (I use only professional grade acid dyes) 
Yards: 170
Weight: thick worsted
Fiber: 100% silk
Care instructions: try to only spot wash. It can be hand washed but do it sparingly and be very gentle. Lay flat to dry.

Why buy hand dyed yarn vs craft store yarn? 
-each dye batch makes unique one-of-a-kind skeins, nobody will have yarn like yours 
-it's made from animal and/or plant fibers, not acrylic aka fake 
-your purchase supports a small business and my small family! 
-made in America

name: Monarch Butterfly Dress
description:
Oh this was fun! Earlier in the day I went to see the new Hunger Games movie, Catching Fire. (It's a great film!) Effie's dresses, in this movie, are INCREDIBLE! I especially loved her get-up made entirely of Monarch Butterflies. It's both beautiful and disturbing...thinking of all those butterflies. The film is also beautiful and disturbing.  
Also on this day, I received a shipment of undyed yarn and I forgot I had ordered these twid looking skeins - perfect for this skein! Needless to say, I dyed these skeins that very night.  
Please keep in mind that each skein is dyed individually and each one is slightly different from the skein in the photos. Even when I use same amount of dye and paint it the same way, each is still unique.

Colors: black, rusty orange (the black, brown and gray specs are woven into the plies) (I use only professional grade acid dyes) 
Yards: 183
Weight: worsted weight 
Fiber: 85% superwash merino, 15% NEP
Care instructions: machine wash gentle cycle, lay flat to dry

Why buy hand dyed yarn vs craft store yarn? 
-each dye batch makes unique one-of-a-kind skeins, nobody will have yarn like yours 
-it's made from animal and/or plant fibers, not acrylic aka fake 
-there will not be any knots or ties hiding in the middle of the skein 
-your purchase supports a small business and my small family! 
-made in America

name: Peppermint Candy Cane
description:
Merino and bamboo! Soft, silky, shiny and fun! Because the bamboo is a plant fiber, and the merino is a protein fiber they don't take dye in the same way. The merino soaks it up and the bamboo doesn't - leaving shiny white streaks through the entire skein. I dyed this roving before spinning it, so I can reproduce something similar. If you'd like more just send me a message. 

Colors: emerald green, brown, ruby red and all shade in between 
Weight: generally worsted weight with gentle thick and thin 
Fiber: 60% merino, 40% bamboo
Yardage: 175 yards, 4 oz. 
Care instructions: hand wash with care, this can felt

name: Felted Wool Dryer Balls
description:
100% wool, 100% natural - no dyes, fragrances or chemicals. 100% safe for your clothing and your skin.

These dryer balls are pretty hefty - about the size of a tennis ball - and they are SOLID felted wool. They are not wrapped yarn or wool roving (which could unravel over time). 

The wool used in these dryer balls has not been carbonized, like commercial yarns and rovings. Carbonization is the process of removing vegetable matter (like hay or grass) from the fiber using sulpheric acid and other toxic chemicals to break down the hay and grass from the wool. This process leaves a chemical residue on the fiber. 

Just throw 3, 4, or more dryer balls (the more the merrier) in your drying load and watch your drying time decrease by at least 25%. The more balls you use the more you save on drying time. You also no longer will need dryer sheets--the wool rids your clothing of static.

They are a small investment for something that lasts so long and saves money on electricity and toxic dryer sheets (have you read the MSDS sheet on dryer sheets...shudder). Keep your family and pets safe and use non toxic dryer balls and last a long, long time, saving you money in the long run.

They come from the earth and return to the earth

(Although these are being advertised as dryer balls, they could also be used in craft projects. Make a snowman, or draw lines to make them look like baseballs or soccer balls. Your kids can draw on them with markers, etc)

name: Merlin's Beard
description:
ON SALE - original price was $26.00

This listing is for TWO skeins.  The first skein is a bulky weight yarn that I plied with thread and added black wooden beads.  I miss calculated how many beads I would need, so the beginning (or the end) of the skein has a few yards without beads, but it is still plied.  The second skein is from the same fiber roving, not plied and is a DK weight.  I am selling these together because they compliment each other so well and would look great combined in the same project. 

(The second photo is both skeins wrapped together.)

Colors: Black, gray/silver, some dark brown
Yards: beaded skein is 36 yards, nonbeaded skein is 103 yards
Weight: beaded skein is bulky with gently thick and thin, nonbeaded is DK-worsted weight
Fiber: mixed BFL
Care instructions: hand wash cool water

This yarn is READY TO SHIP. The yarn you see in the photos is the yarn you will get. :-) 
I did my best to get an accurate picture of the colors, I take my photos during the day using natural lighting and do not edit my photos in any way. Please be aware that computer monitors vary and so may the colors.

name: Felted Soap - 50% off SALE
description:
Each bar was $7.00, now $3.50! (I am not thrilled with the appearance of these remaining bars. They are felted well, still smell super yummy-handmade soap-I just ran the wool through my carder too many times and the colors are too well blended, IMO. So...they are now 50% off!)

What is felted soap? (Each bar weighs 3.5-4 ounces)
Felted soap is basically wool wrapped around a bar of soap and then the wool is felted to insure it stays put. It acts as a built-in washcloth around the soap. It functions as a gentle exfoliator and will shrink with the soap as the soap shrinks. Plenty of suds are still able to get through the wool and the wool helps the soap last longer. This wool is naturally anti-microbial so no worries about mold or mildew. After each use simply squeeze out the excess water and leave it propped on its side so it can dry completely--don't leave it sitting in water and you won't be left with a messy puddle of soap (like what happens with naked soap). When the soap is gone you're left with a wool cloth that will remain scented. Put the yummy smelling fiber in your dresser drawers to keep clothes smelling fresh, or in smelly shoes to keep the odor away!

I dyed this wool myself, carded it and then felted each bar by hand. The fibers used on these bars is merino wool (the softest most gentle wool) and alpaca (unbelievably silky soft). The colors are blended bright pink, yellow, green, peach and a bit of black. Each bar has a fun tie-dyed look, you just need to choose your desired scent.

Ingredients in handmade soap: coconut oil, palm oil, olive oil. Scented with pure essential oils. Colored with natural herbs.

Feel free to message me with any questions.

name: Crochet Infinity Scarf with V Front - READY TO SHIP
description:
This is READY TO SHIP and will be mailed within 1-2 business days.

This scarf is BEAUTIFUL! It is made with superwash merino (machine washable) worsted weight yarn. Merino is the finest quality of wool because it is so soft. Although this scarf is 100% wool, it is next-to-skin soft and won't leave you itchy. I hand dyed the yarn (I only use professional grade acid dyes), waited for it to dry, then crocheted it into this v-shaped infinity scarf and added fringe to the front/v-shape. In the photos of it being modeled, it has been wrapped around twice. Wrapping it around once will allow for a looser and cooler fit. There are many ways this can be worn. This would make a great gift or a lovely accessory to your fall and winter wardrobe.

Feel free to contact me with any questions

name: The Sorting Hat - CUSTOM ORDER
description:
(This listing is for CUSTOM ORDERS. I can make this in any size.  It should be ready to ship within 5 business days after the order is made - usually sooner.  If it will take me longer to finish for some reason, I'll contact you and let you know when you can expect it to ship)

He's so NERVOUS! What house will be his? Not Slytherin...not Slytherin.....GRYFFINDOR!  The Harry Potter house Sorting Hat! A must have for any fan. :-)

This was so fun to make! We are big Harry Potter fans in our house, so I was thrilled to find this pattern. I used black and brown yarn together to get the color I wanted, but I could make it all black or all brown if you want.  The grumpy facial expression is stitches in so it won't change regardless of positioning (slight changes can be made, but in general the face will hold its shape). One size fits most, but please let me know the age of the person who will wear this so I can make slight adjustments if needed.

Feel free to contact me with any questions.

(made from a variation of a pattern by Crafty is Cool)

description:

Weight: fingering
Length/yardage: 437 yards/400 meters, 3.5 oz/100grams
Care instructions: machine washable, lay flat to dry

-each dye batch makes unique one-of-a-kind skeins, nobody will have yarn like yours

name: Sparkler
description:
This is a gradual color changing skein. When being crocheted or knit it will go from red-white-blue, or from blue-white-red depending on which end you start with. Skeins like this make really cool hats and other items done in a round.

Fiber: superwash merino (machine washable)
Weight: worsted
Yards: 176 yards

(1 available - contact me if you need more than one).

name: Rainbow Bright
description:
This skein is out-of-this-world SOFT!! It was such a joy to spin. :-) Each color is around 14 yards so as this is being stitched up it will make long stripes -- making this a self-striping skein. It would make a great hat, headband, or trim around a finished piece. 

Colors: neon pink, green, yellow, blue, purple
Yards: 70
Weight: bulky thick and thin
Fiber: superfine merino, firestar (sparkles!!!)
Care instructions: hand wash cool water

This yarn is READY TO SHIP. The yarn you see in the photos is the yarn you will get. :-) 
I did my best to get an accurate picture of the colors, I take my photos during the day using natural lighting and do not edit my photos in any way. Please be aware that computer monitors vary and so may the colors.

(1 available - contact me if you need more than one).

name: Fuzzy Caterpillar
description:
When it comes to yarn, specifically handspun yarn, there is nothing like a dramatic thick and thin skein! The variations in weight give your finished item such incredible texture - it makes a truely unique item. This skein fits it's name perfectly - it's fuzzy and will transform into a beautiful new creations, just like a caterpillar into a butterfly! 

Colors: what color ISN'T in this beauty?
Yards: 60 
Weight: Fingering-super bulky thick & thin 
Fiber: 100% superwash merino (will not felt)
Care instructions: hand wash cool water
